definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: I cannot pass the matter by without making a protest.
sentences.chinese: 我不能對此事聽之任之。

sentences.english: When velocity swings widely, the Fed shouldn't be passive.
sentences.chinese: 當週轉率大幅擺動時，聯儲不該聽之任之。

sentences.english: Therefore, no longer on the "Real's" acts go unheeded .
sentences.chinese: 因此，不能再對“炒房團”的行爲聽之任之。

sentences.english: It's short-sighted to think you can optimize your Web site and leave it be.
sentences.chinese: 如果認爲你優化完網站就聽之任之，這是目光短淺的。

sentences.english: Some local officials reinforced their dykes; others allowed them to fail.
sentences.chinese: 當地有些官員採取措施加固大壩，有的則聽之任之。

sentences.english: We can't take a laissez-faire attitude to drug abuse.
sentences.chinese: 我們對毒品氾濫不能聽之任之。
